metadata.title: CVE-2015-1251 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the SpeechRecognitionClient implementationin the Speech subsystem in Google Chrome before 43.0.2357.65 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089').
